1.title: Our team
1.description: Meet the leaders driving innovation and excellence

1.name: Dr. Sarah Chen
1.bio: Dr. Chen brings over 25 years of experience in global infrastructure development. Previously served as Regional Director at a Fortune 500 engineering firm. PhD in Civil Engineering from MIT.

3.name: James Morrison
3.bio: James oversees global operations across 140+ countries. Former operations director at major international consultancy. MBA from London Business School with 20+ years in project delivery.

5.name: Dr. Amara Okonkwo
5.bio: Dr. Okonkwo leads digital transformation initiatives and emerging technology integration. Former tech lead at Google. PhD in Computer Science from Stanford with expertise in AI/ML applications.

7.name: Michael Torres
7.bio: Michael leads our mining practice with 18 years of experience in mineral exploration and resource development across Africa, Asia, and South America. MSc in Mining Engineering from Colorado School of Mines.

9.name: Dr. Elena Petrova
9.bio: Dr. Petrov specializes in environmental impact assessment and sustainable development. Published researcher with 50+ peer-reviewed papers. PhD in Environmental Science from ETH Zurich.

11.name: Robert Nakamura
11.bio: Robert leads our geotechnical practice with expertise in foundation design and ground improvement. 22 years of experience on major infrastructure projects. PE licensed in multiple jurisdictions.

1.title: Atacama Solar Complex 1123
1.shortSummary: Latin America's largest photovoltaic installation delivering 450MW of clean energy to the national grid, powering over 300,000 homes.

children.text: The Atacama Solar Complex represents a landmark achievement in renewable energy infrastructure for South America. Located in the world's driest desert with exceptional solar irradiance levels, this 450MW facility spans over 1,000 hectares and incorporates cutting-edge bifacial panel technology.

The project faced significant engineering challenges including extreme temperature variations, seismic activity considerations, remote location logistics, and the need to integrate with Chile's complex electrical grid while maintaining environmental compliance in a sensitive desert ecosystem.

Our team deployed advanced geotechnical surveys, developed custom foundation solutions for seismic resilience, and implemented a modular construction approach to overcome logistical challenges. We utilized digital twin technology for real-time monitoring and predictive maintenance planning.

outcomes: Reduces CO2 emissions by 600,000 tonnes annually
Created 2,500 construction jobs and 150 permanent positions
Achieved 99.2% grid availability in first year

4.title: North Sea Offshore Wind Farm
4.shortSummary: A 1.2GW offshore wind installation featuring 80 next-generation turbines, contributing significantly to UK's net-zero targets.

children.text: This flagship offshore wind development represents one of Europe's largest single-phase wind farm installations. The project features 80 state-of-the-art 15MW turbines positioned in water depths of 25-40 meters.

Engineering challenges included harsh North Sea conditions, complex seabed geology, marine wildlife protection requirements, and coordination of multiple specialized vessels during a tight weather-dependent construction window.

We employed advanced metocean analysis, innovative monopile foundation designs, and real-time environmental monitoring systems. Our digital delivery team created comprehensive BIM models integrated with marine operations planning.

outcomes: Established new UK supply chain partnerships
Marine habitat enhancement through artificial reef creation

8.title: Oyu Tolgoi Copper-Gold Mine
8.shortSummary: Technical advisory for one of the world's largest copper-gold mining operations, implementing sustainable extraction methodologies.

children.text: Oyu Tolgoi is a world-class copper and gold mining operation in Mongolia's South Gobi Desert. Our involvement focused on the underground expansion project, one of the most technically challenging mining developments globally.

The project presented unique challenges including extreme continental climate (-40°C to +40°C), complex geological conditions, remote infrastructure requirements, and the need to balance economic development with environmental stewardship in a fragile desert ecosystem.

Our multidisciplinary team provided geotechnical engineering, water management solutions, and economic feasibility analysis. We implemented innovative block-cave mining techniques and developed comprehensive environmental management systems.

outcomes: Reduced water consumption by 35% through recycling

10.title: Mombasa Water Supply Programme
10.shortSummary: Comprehensive water infrastructure upgrade serving 1.5 million residents with improved access to clean, reliable water supply.

children.text: "The Mombasa Water Supply Programme addresses critical water scarcity challenges facing Kenya's second-largest city. This comprehensive infrastructure upgrade includes new treatment facilities, transmission pipelines, and distribution network rehabilitation.

The project navigated challenges including aging infrastructure, informal settlements requiring sensitive community engagement, limited financial resources, and the need to maintain service continuity during construction phases.

We employed participatory planning approaches, phased construction to maintain service, and capacity building programs for local water utility staff. Innovative financing mechanisms were developed in partnership with international development agencies.

outcomes: 1.5 million people with improved water access
24/7 water supply achieved in 80% of service area
Model replicated in three other Kenyan cities

12.title: BR-163 Amazon Highway Upgrade
12.shortSummary: 600km highway improvement through the Amazon, balancing connectivity needs with rainforest preservation.

children.text: The BR-163 upgrade project improved a critical agricultural corridor while implementing comprehensive environmental protection measures in the Amazon rainforest region.

Balancing infrastructure improvement with environmental protection in one of the world's most biodiverse regions, while managing stakeholder expectations from agricultural, indigenous, and conservation communities.
We developed innovative wildlife crossing solutions, implemented real-time deforestation monitoring, and engaged extensively with local communities to minimize social and environmental impacts.

14.title: Dubai Metro Blue Line Extension
14.shortSummary: 25km metro extension connecting Dubai Marina to Expo 2020 site with 11 new stations.

children.text: The Blue Line extension represents a significant expansion of Dubai's metro network, providing enhanced connectivity to key development areas and reducing road congestion.
Constructing underground infrastructure in challenging ground conditions with high water tables, while minimizing disruption to one of the world's busiest urban areas.
Advanced tunnel boring technology, real-time ground monitoring systems, and comprehensive traffic management plans enabled construction with minimal surface disruption.

outcomes: Integration with bus and tram networks
LEED Gold certification for all stations

3.name: Energy
3.shortDesc: Energy infrastructure and power generation across conventional and renewable sources.
3.overview: Delivering comprehensive energy solutions from conventional power generation to renewable energy systems, transmission infrastructure, and energy transition projects.

5.name: Water
5.shortDesc: Water treatment, environmental remediation, and conservation
5.overview:
Water is essential to life, and this critical resource needs to be effectively managed to meet the needs of multiple stakeholders and the natural environment.

Significant threats to water security and competing demands include extreme weather events, population growth, ageing assets, increasing water recycling and tighter environmental standards. Water is also a resource that plays a role in the transition to a low carbon energy future.

That’s why long term planning is critical to address water scarcity issues proactively and provide resilience in the face of population growth and climate change. 

The response to these challenges increasingly forms part of a systems thinking approach, which can be delivered through careful blending of nature based and traditionally engineered solutions. And by further integrating digital technologies for prediction and optimised system operations, we can better understand river catchment behaviours and the impacts of droughts and flooding.

7.name: Transport
7.shortDesc: Roads, bridges, airports, and rail infrastructure
7.overview:
Effective development and delivery of transport infrastructure is essential to realise the benefits from efficient and sustainable transport networks.

Success requires timely and cost-effective project completion, with a focus on creating safe and climate resilient infrastructure that benefits the economy, society and the environment.

9.name: Building
9.overview: Our Buildings team delivers integrated design and engineering services for all building types, from concept through construction and operation. We combine architectural vision with technical expertise to create sustainable, efficient, and inspiring spaces.

1.title: Senior Structural Engineer
1.summary: Lead complex structural design projects for major infrastructure developments across Europe.

Ensure compliance with relevant codes and standards
Contribute to business development and client relationships
requirements: Chartered Engineer (CEng) or equivalent
10+ years of structural engineering experience
Proficiency in structural analysis software (SAP2000, ETABS, STAAD)
Strong communication and leadership skills
Experience with BIM workflows

Monitor environmental compliance during construction

5+ years of environmental consulting experience
Knowledge of Australian environmental legislation
Strong report writing and presentation skills
Experience with GIS and environmental modeling tools

Strong programming skills in Python, JavaScript, or similar

1.title: The future of infrastructure is digital
1.excerpt: How digital twins and data analytics are revolutionizing the way we design, build, and operate assets.

children.text:
Digital transformation is reshaping the infrastructure sector. From design through construction to operation, digital technologies are enabling unprecedented levels of efficiency, safety, and sustainability.

Digital twins - virtual replicas of physical assets - are at the forefront of this transformation. By combining real-time sensor data with advanced analytics and AI, digital twins enable predictive maintenance, optimized operations, and informed decision-making throughout an asset's lifecycle.

The benefits extend across the project lifecycle: improved design accuracy, reduced construction waste, enhanced operational efficiency, and extended asset life. Early adopters are seeing 20-30% reductions in operational costs and significant improvements in safety performance.

3.title: Nature-based solutions for climate resilience
3.excerpt: Integrating natural systems into urban planning to mitigate flood risks and enhance biodiversity.

children.text:
As cities face increasing climate-related challenges, nature-based solutions offer a compelling approach to building resilience while delivering multiple co-benefits.

From green infrastructure and constructed wetlands to urban forests and permeable surfaces, these solutions work with natural processes to manage stormwater, reduce urban heat islands, improve air quality, and enhance biodiversity.

Our experience across global projects demonstrates that nature-based solutions can be cost-effective alternatives or complements to traditional grey infrastructure, often delivering better long-term value when considering full lifecycle costs and co-benefits.

3.author: James Morrison

5.title: Accelerating the energy transition
5.excerpt: New partnerships announced to drive hydrogen adoption across heavy industry sectors in Europe.

children.text:
The transition to clean energy is accelerating, driven by policy commitments, technological advances, and economic opportunities. Hydrogen is emerging as a critical enabler for decarbonizing hard-to-abate sectors.

We are proud to announce new strategic partnerships with leading European industrial players to develop hydrogen infrastructure and integration solutions. These collaborations will support the production, distribution, and utilization of green hydrogen across steel, chemicals, and heavy transport sectors.

The projects represent investments of over EUR 2 billion and will create thousands of jobs while contributing to Europe's climate neutrality goals.

5.author: Maria Santos

7.title: Building resilient water systems for a changing climate
7.excerpt: Strategies for water utilities to adapt infrastructure and operations to climate variability.

children.text:
Climate change is fundamentally altering the water cycle, creating new challenges for water utilities worldwide. From more intense droughts to increased flooding, water systems must adapt to greater variability and uncertainty.

Successful adaptation requires integrated approaches combining infrastructure upgrades, operational improvements, and demand management. Our water resilience framework helps utilities assess vulnerabilities, prioritize investments, and develop adaptive management strategies.

Key strategies include diversifying water sources, implementing smart water networks, enhancing storage capacity, and improving system flexibility to respond to changing conditions.

7.author: Dr. Fatima Al-Hassan

9.title: The role of geophysics in sustainable mining
9.excerpt: How advanced geophysical techniques are enabling more efficient and environmentally responsible mineral exploration.

children.text:
As demand for critical minerals grows to support the energy transition, the mining industry faces pressure to find and develop resources more sustainably. Advanced geophysics is playing a crucial role in meeting this challenge.

Modern geophysical techniques enable more targeted exploration, reducing the environmental footprint of discovery programs. By providing detailed subsurface information, geophysics helps optimize drill programs, minimize land disturbance, and improve resource estimation accuracy.

From airborne electromagnetics to 3D seismic imaging, our geophysics team is at the forefront of applying these technologies to support responsible resource development.

9.author: Michael Torres

1.title: About Us
1.description: Shaping a better future through connected thinking
